title: English Heritage typeface?
content:
Hello,

I'm looking to identify the type on this english heritage plaque. Many thanks for any help in advance.

Julian

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20111219103836im_/http:/typophile.com/files/english_heritage_sign_5130.jpg)
author: bittinerj

comments.content:
Thanks Lex, you're right, I should have noticed the difference between letters. Do you have a sense of what type style(s) is informing it?

I just found an imitation font distributed by K-Type called 'Blue Plaque' but I would prefer it not simulate the engraving: [http://www.k-type.com/?p=548](http://web.archive.org/web/20111219103836/http:/www.k-type.com/?p=548 "http://www.k-type.com/?p=548")

Here is an obituary to the designer of the blue plaque, Henry Hooper: [http://www.independent.co.uk/news/obituaries/henry-hooper-529544.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20111219103836/http:/www.independent.co.uk/news/obituaries/henry-hooper-529544.html "http://www.independent.co.uk/news/obituaries/henry-hooper-529544.html")

And in the spirit of answering my own query, more info on the design here: [http://www.english-heritage.org.uk/server/show/nav.1496](http://web.archive.org/web/20111219103836/http:/www.english-heritage.org.uk/server/show/nav.1496 "http://www.english-heritage.org.uk/server/show/nav.1496")

That last link indicates that it is their own (custom) font. I guess you will have to find something similar.

- Mike Yanega

Goudy Sans has a similar spirit. The rougher version from P22 might suit your project:

LTC Goudy Sans  
 [http://p22.com/lanston/goudysans.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20111219103836/http:/p22.com/lanston/goudysans.html "http://p22.com/lanston/goudysans.html")

ITC Goudy Sans  
 [http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/itc-goudy-sans/](http://web.archive.org/web/20111219103836/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/itc-goudy-sans/ "http://new.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/itc-goudy-sans/")
